title: phpunit setup through github
body:
Hi, I followed your instructions for setting up phpunit.

However, when I run phpunit, I get this error:

```
[~/vagrant/rv/lib/phpunit]$ ./phpunit/phpunit.php                                

Warning: require_once(File/Iterator/Autoload.php): failed to open stream: No such file or directory in /vagrant/rv/lib/
phpunit/phpunit/PHPUnit/Autoload.php on line 45                                                                        

Fatal error: require_once(): Failed opening required 'File/Iterator/Autoload.php' (include_path='.:/usr/share/pear:/usr
/share/php') in /vagrant/rv/lib/phpunit/phpunit/PHPUnit/Autoload.php on line 45                                        
```

I've been trying to find a way to include the directories that were git cloned in the git instructions, but no luck.

How do I add all the dirs in my include_path?

```
[~/vagrant/rv/lib/phpunit]$ ls                                                                                    
dbunit             php-file-iterator  php-text-template  php-token-stream  phpunit-mock-objects  phpunit-story    
php-code-coverage  php-invoker        php-timer          phpunit           phpunit-selenium                       
```

Also. Another option I looked into was to add these include_paths to a php script using

```
set_include_path(get_include_path() . PATH_SEPARATOR . 'mypath' . '/php-file-iterator/');
```

for example...  but then I will need to be able to run phpunit directly from within that script, and I Don't see any documentation on how to do that.

I would expect something like:  `PHPUnit_File_Command::run("some_path_to_my_test_file.php");`

Sorry if this is the wrong forum to ask for help. I looked for other likely candidates. #phpunit is dead :/
